description:
The user must be able to play Connect 4
  I need the Board class to call the Game class
  So I can play the game.

elements.name: The Constructor recieves an instance of Game

steps.name: that the constructor recieves an argument
the argument should be an instance of Game

elements.name: The Constructor should throw an error message

steps.name: that the constructor argument is not a instance of Game
an error should display "game must be an instance of Game"

elements.name: The elements of the Matrix board

steps.name: that Board has a matrix property
the array has six elements that each stores seven elements
every element has the value zero
that the game has a board
the default value of the currentPlayer property is one
the default value of the playInProgress property is false

elements.name: The Board constructor call to methods

steps.name: that the Board constructor is called
addEventListener, render, tellTurn should be called in the stated order
that the tellTurn method in being called
the tellTurns inargument should be currentPlayer property

name: The Board class constructor

description:
As a player
  I want the game to stop me from making a move when it's not possible
  So I can play the game properly

steps.name: that the method recieves an argument that isn't an integer between zero and six
it should throw an error saying "column must be an integer between 0 and 6"
that playInProgress is true
makeMove should return null
that the selected column is full
it makeMove should return false

name: When making a move isn't possible

description:
As a player
  I want to be able to make a move when it's possible
  So I can play the game

steps.name: that makeMove is possible
the board method render should be called
the move was possible and that currentPlayer is one
currentPlayer should be set to two
the move was possible and that currentPlayer is two
currentPlayer should be set to one
that the move was possible
the tellTurn method should be called with the currentPlayer as argument
that the move is possible
it should set playInProgress to false
that winCheck wasn't truthy
in the end makeMove returns true

name: When making a move is possible

description:
As a player
  I want to be able to see if someone won
  So I can celebrate

steps.name: that method winCheck returns something truthy
makeMove should call removeEventListener

elements.name: winCheck returns an object with combo

steps.name: that winCheck returns an object with a combo attribute
the markWin method should be called with the combo value as argument
makeMove should return true
that winCheck returns an object with a winner attribute
the over method should be called with winner value as argument

name: When calling on makeMove with a winner

elements.name: The method should check if a player has won

steps.name: that one of the players has won
the method markWin(combo) recieves the argument combo
adds the css-class win to each one of the div-element.

name: Check if a player has won

description:
As a non-blind player
  I want to be able to see the board
  so I can play the game

steps.name: that a game is in play
the DOM element .board should have fortytwo divs in it
that a player has a brick on a spot
the div on that spot should have the class representing the player
that the board has fortytwo divs in it
each of those divs should have an empty div in them

name: Rendering the board

description:
As a competetive connect 4 player
  I want to know if someone has won
  So I crush my enemies

steps.name: that the a player has won
winCheck() returns an object with the winner and combo attribute
that someone has won
the winner attribute of the winCheck() return value should be one / two
that the outcome of the game is a tie
the winner attribute of the winCheck() return value should be 'draw'

elements.name: The game is still going on

steps.name: that neither of player has won and the game isn't a tie
winCheck() should return the value false

name: A method that checks if the board has won

description:
As a Connect 4 player user
  I want to know when I have clicked a button
  So I know that I can play.

steps.name: that the method addEventListeners has an EventListener with a click event
the start method should be called.

name: Notification when a button in clicked

description:
As a gamer
  I want the constructor to call on the methods
  So I can play the game.

steps.name: that the game starts
the constructor should call addEventListener and start in order

name: Call methods in constructor

description:
The user shall during the game be informed
  by a visual display who has won or if the Game
  is a draw. Furthermore a play again button should also
  be displayed.

steps.name: that the methods recives an invalid argument
an error message "won must be “draw”, 1 or 2" be thrown
that the game has ended as draw
a message displaying “Det blev oavgjort!”
that the game has finished and red has won
a message displaying the winner Röd vann!
that the game has finished and yellow has won
a message displaying the winner Gul vann!
that the game is over
the .message element should have a button with the class again

name: The Game class win

description:
As a player
  I want to be able to start a game
  So I can play with my friends

steps.name: a game is being started
the Game.start() method should create a new board stored in this.board

name: Starting the game

description:
As a player
  I want to know who's turn it is
  So the right player makes a move

steps.name: the taken argument is not one or two
it should throw "player must be 1 or 2"
that it is yellows turn
the .message element should display Guls tur...
that it is reds turn
the .message element should display Röds tur...

name: The game should say who's turn it is
